# hv_vcpu_run_until(_:_:)

**Function**

Executes a vCPU until it reaches the deadline defined in absolute time units you provide.

## Declaration

```swift
func hv_vcpu_run_until(_ vcpu: hv_vcpuid_t, _ deadline: UInt64) -> hv_return_t
```

## Parameters

- **vcpu**: The instance of the vCPU.
- **deadline**: The timer deadline in mach absolute time units. Use the special value [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_DEADLINE_FOREVER] to specify a deadline that never expires.

## Return Value

[doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_SUCCESS] if the operation was successful, otherwise an error code specified in [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_return_t].

## Discussion

If the deadline you specify is other than [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_DEADLINE_FOREVER], this call uses the VMX preemption timer. If the hardware doesn’t support the VMX preemption timer, it returns [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/HV_UNSUPPORTED].

This function supersedes [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_vcpu_run(_:)] on Intel-based Mac computers. Unlike [doc://com.apple.hypervisor/documentation/Hypervisor/hv_vcpu_run(_:)], it doesn’t return on transparently handled VMEXITs.

## Runtime

- **hv_vcpu_interrupt(_:_:)**: Forces the vCPU instances you provide to immediately exit the VM.
- **hv_vcpu_invalidate_tlb(_:)**: Invalidates the translation look-aside buffer (TLB) of a vCPU.
- **hv_vcpu_flush(_:)**: Flushes the cached state of a vCPU.
- **hv_vcpu_get_exec_time(_:_:)**: Returns, by reference, the cumulative execution time of a vCPU, in nanoseconds.
- **hv_vcpu_run(_:)**: Starts the execution of a vCPU.
- **Execution Deadlines**: An enumeration that describes available execution deadlines available to vCPUs.
